trustfund:
TF035966-INDIA - COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION
            IN WOMEN AND CHILD HEALTH

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project is rated as
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned include: 1) It is
            necessary to have flexibility in project design to match the
            varying requirements and capacities of the individual
            project states. 2) It is critical to limit the project scope
            and focus on key interventions, particularly in low capacity
            settings. 3) It is imperative to give top priority to
            monitoring and evaluation. Even more crucial is the creation
            of a culture for using service data as a proactive
            management tool for timely feedback and corrective actions.
            4) The project experience reiterates the problem of
            under-utilization of certain physical facilities constructed
            under the project, in particular Female Multi-purpose Worker
            residential accommodation. 5) There are chronic operational
            problems that adversely affect implementation of all Family
            Welfare Projects in weaker states. Unless resolved at a more
            macro level, they continue to constrain implementation and
            create problems of long range sustainability. 6) An
            important lesson is the need for the government to create
            incentives to the states through performance-based financing
            during project implementation. 7) This project demonstrates
            effective use of the lower cost supervision mechanisms based
            on a strengthened Bank field office presence.
